events.name: Russia cuts natural gas supplies
events.wd_description: Russia will cut natural gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to pay in rubles, escalating tensions with the West.
events.description: Russia will cut natural gas supplies to Poland and Bulgaria after they refused to pay in rubles, escalating tensions with the West.

events.name: PGNiG statement
events.wd_description: PGNiG, Poland's state-run gas company, stated that Gazprom informed it on April 26 of the decision to fully suspend deliveries under the Yamal contract starting April 27.
events.description: PGNiG, Poland's state-run gas company, stated that Gazprom informed it on April 26 of the decision to fully suspend deliveries under the Yamal contract starting April 27.

events.name: Suspension of gas supplies
events.wd_description: PGNiG announced it would suspend gas supplies along the Yamal pipeline starting Wednesday morning.
events.description: PGNiG announced it would suspend gas supplies along the Yamal pipeline starting Wednesday morning.

events.name: Market reaction
events.wd_description: The news of the suspension sent US natural gas futures up about 3% on Tuesday.
events.description: The news of the suspension sent US natural gas futures up about 3% on Tuesday.

events.name: Record-breaking heatwave in Japan, June 2022
events.wd_description: Japan is experiencing its worst heatwave since records began in 1875, with temperatures exceeding 35°C in Tokyo for five consecutive days and a record high of 40.2°C in Isesaki, leading to government warnings and health concerns.
events.description: Japan is experiencing its worst heatwave since records began in 1875, with temperatures exceeding 35°C in Tokyo for five consecutive days and a record high of 40.2°C in Isesaki, leading to government warnings and health concerns.

events.name: Heatwave impact in Tokyo
events.wd_description: Tokyo experienced temperatures exceeding 35°C for five consecutive days, marking the worst heatwave in June since records began in 1875.
events.description: Tokyo experienced temperatures exceeding 35°C for five consecutive days, marking the worst heatwave in June since records began in 1875.

events.name: Record temperatures in Isesaki
events.wd_description: Isesaki, northwest of Tokyo, recorded a temperature of 40.2°C, the highest ever recorded in June in Japan.
events.description: Isesaki, northwest of Tokyo, recorded a temperature of 40.2°C, the highest ever recorded in June in Japan.

events.name: Government response and health advisories
events.wd_description: The government issued warnings about potential power outages and advised citizens to use air conditioning to prevent heatstroke, as hospitalizations increased with the ongoing heatwave.
events.description: The government issued warnings about potential power outages and advised citizens to use air conditioning to prevent heatstroke, as hospitalizations increased with the ongoing heatwave.

events.name: Severe Flooding and Mudslides Displace Thousands in South Africa
events.wd_label: Severe Flooding and Mudslides Displace Thousands in South Africa
events.wd_description: Severe flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and caused extensive damage, highlighting the increasing toll of climate change and the need for a stronger government response.
events.description: Severe flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and caused extensive damage, highlighting the increasing toll of climate change and the need for a stronger government response.

events.name: Displacement and Destruction in South Africa
events.wd_label: Displacement and Destruction in South Africa
events.wd_description: Flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and damaged approximately 8,300 others, with the nation mourning the loss and devastation.
events.description: Flooding and mudslides in South Africa have displaced over 40,000 people, destroyed nearly 4,000 homes, and damaged approximately 8,300 others, with the nation mourning the loss and devastation.

events.name: Impact of Climate Change on Vulnerable Communities
events.wd_label: Impact of Climate Change on Vulnerable Communities
events.wd_description: The flooding and mudslides are part of a series of powerful storms affecting southern and eastern Africa, underscoring the increasing toll of climate change on the most vulnerable communities.
events.description: The flooding and mudslides are part of a series of powerful storms affecting southern and eastern Africa, underscoring the increasing toll of climate change on the most vulnerable communities.

events.name: Call for Government Action
events.wd_description: Experts, including Jasper Knight, have emphasized the need for more aggressive government action in South Africa and other developing countries to protect vulnerable communities from the rising number of weather-related disasters.
events.description: Experts, including Jasper Knight, have emphasized the need for more aggressive government action in South Africa and other developing countries to protect vulnerable communities from the rising number of weather-related disasters.

events.name: Private equity funds seeking minority stake in Benchmark Mineral Intelligence (BMI)
events.wd_label: Private equity funds seeking minority stake in Benchmark Mineral Intelligence (BMI)
events.wd_description: Private equity funds are seeking a minority stake in Benchmark Mineral Intelligence (BMI) to gain exposure to the electric-vehicle battery supply chain.
events.description: Private equity funds are seeking a minority stake in Benchmark Mineral Intelligence (BMI) to gain exposure to the electric-vehicle battery supply chain.

events.name: Interest from private equity firms
events.wd_description: UK-based Hg Capital and Bowmark Capital are among the private equity firms seeking to buy a stake of up to 20% in Benchmark, valued at over 200 million pounds.
events.description: UK-based Hg Capital and Bowmark Capital are among the private equity firms seeking to buy a stake of up to 20% in Benchmark, valued at over 200 million pounds.

events.name: Role of Cardean Bell
events.wd_description: The process of selling a stake in Benchmark is being run by corporate advisory firm Cardean Bell.
events.description: The process of selling a stake in Benchmark is being run by corporate advisory firm Cardean Bell.

events.name: Rising interest in battery materials
events.wd_description: Interest in battery materials such as lithium, nickel, cobalt, and graphite has been rising, driven by the energy transition and increasing EV sales.
events.description: Interest in battery materials such as lithium, nickel, cobalt, and graphite has been rising, driven by the energy transition and increasing EV sales.

events.name: Benchmark's offerings
events.wd_description: Benchmark provides price assessments, detailed information about costs of production in the supply chain, and information about cathode and anode manufacturers and battery makers.
events.description: Benchmark provides price assessments, detailed information about costs of production in the supply chain, and information about cathode and anode manufacturers and battery makers.

events.name: Growth in lithium-ion battery and EV supply chain
events.wd_label: Growth in lithium-ion battery and EV supply chain
events.wd_description: The lithium-ion battery and EV supply chain is growing at 25% a year, driving demand for information about the sector.
events.description: The lithium-ion battery and EV supply chain is growing at 25% a year, driving demand for information about the sector.

events.name: Benchmark's market position
events.wd_description: Benchmark rivals price reporting agencies such as Fastmarkets, Platts, CRU, and Wood Mackenzie in its coverage of battery materials and related supply chains.
events.description: Benchmark rivals price reporting agencies such as Fastmarkets, Platts, CRU, and Wood Mackenzie in its coverage of battery materials and related supply chains.

events.name: Benchmark's employment growth
events.wd_description: Subscription-based Benchmark, started by Simon Moores in 2017, expects to employ more than 100 people by next year.
events.description: Subscription-based Benchmark, started by Simon Moores in 2017, expects to employ more than 100 people by next year.

events.name: Benchmark as an ESG investment
events.wd_description: Private equity funds see Benchmark as an ESG investment for the electric vehicle revolution.
events.description: Private equity funds see Benchmark as an ESG investment for the electric vehicle revolution.

events.name: Lithium-ion battery supply growth
events.wd_description: Supplies of lithium-ion batteries are expected to rise 50% this year to 600 gigawatt hours from last year.
events.description: Supplies of lithium-ion batteries are expected to rise 50% this year to 600 gigawatt hours from last year.

events.name: Volkswagen's EV plans
events.wd_description: Volkswagen delivered 452,000 battery-electric vehicles globally last year and aims for half of its global output to be all-electric by 2030.
events.description: Volkswagen delivered 452,000 battery-electric vehicles globally last year and aims for half of its global output to be all-electric by 2030.

events.name: US EV sales goal
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden has set a goal of 50% of new-vehicle sales being electric or plug-in electric by 2030.
events.description: President Joe Biden has set a goal of 50% of new-vehicle sales being electric or plug-in electric by 2030.
